intro: Davya villosa, commonly known as the hairy davya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Davya villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
